English (en):
Search syntax (press enter/return to trigger a search):
  • coat: match exact term coat
  • coat*: match terms that start with coat as one term
  • ^coat*: match terms that start with coat as separate terms (coat, coats, etc.)
  • *oat: match terms that end with oad as one term
  • ^*oat: match terms that end with oad as multiple terms
  • coat,jacket: match each term separated by commas as separate terms
  • coat|jacket: match terms separate by pipe as a single term
  • "winter coat": winter coat as a phrase
  • "coat mittens"~5: coat near mittens (within 5 words)
  • ^coat*,jacket|parka,"coat mittens"~5: combine syntaxes

English (en): Bubblelines visualizes the frequency and repetition of  a term's use in a corpus. Each document in the corpus is represented as a horizontal line and divided into segments of equal lengths. Each term is represented as a bubble, the size of the bubble indicates its frequency in the corresponding segment of text. The larger the bubble's radius the more frequently the term occurs.
Italian (it): Bubblelines visualizza la frequenza di un termine in un corpus. Ogni documento nel corpus è rappresentato come una linea orizzontale e suddiviso in segmenti di uguale lunghezza. Il raggio della bolla è tanto più grande quanto più frequente è il termine.

English (en):
Cirrus provides a wordcloud view of the most frequently occurring words in the corpus or document – this provides a convenient (though reductive) overview of the content. Features include

  • term frequency appears when hovering over words
  • clicking on terms may produce results in other tools if any are displayed

  • la frequenza di un termine appare quando il puntatore del mouse si posiziona sopra le parole
  • facendo click su un termine si possono generare risultati nelle finestre degli altri strumenti, se sono visualizzate

Bosnian (bs): Cirrus prikazuje oblak najučestalijih riječi u korpusu ili dokumentu; nudi praktičan (iako reduktivan) pregled sadržaja. Pozicioniranjem kursora na riječi otkriva se učestalost termina. Klikom na termine, pojavljuju se rezultati u drugim alatkama, ukoliko su prikazane.

  • frekvence termínů se ukáže po najetí kurzorem na slova
  • kliknutím na termíny mohou být vytvořeny výsledky v dalších nástrojích, pokud jsou tyto zobrazeny

English (en):
Collocates graph shows a network graph of higher frequency terms that appear in proximity. Keywords are shown in blue and collocates (words in proximity) are showing in orange. Features include:

  • hovering over keywords shows their frequency in the corpus
  • hovering over collocates shows their frequency in proximity (not their total frequency)
  • double-clicking on any word fetches more results
  • a search box for queries (hover over the magnifying icon for help with the syntax)

  • quando il puntatore del mouse si posiziona sopra le parole chiave viene mostrata la loro frequenza nel corpus
  • quando il puntatore del mouse si posiziona sopra le parole collocate viene mostrata la loro frequenza nel contesto di prossimità (non la frequenza totale)
  • facendo doppio click su ogni parola si ottengono ulteriori risultati
  • è disponibile una casella di ricerca (posizionare il mouse sopra l'icona lente di ingrandimento per un aiuto sulla sintassi)

English (en):
This tool allows you to create a corpus in one of three ways:
  1. by typing or pasting text into the text box and clicking Reveal; if each line in the text box is a URL, text is fetched from those URLs, otherwise the contents are treated as a single document
  2. click the Open button to open an existing corpus
  3. click the Upload button to upload one or more files from you computer (you can select multiple files by using the Ctrl and/or Shift keys)

  2. clicca il pulsante Apri per aprire un corpus esistente

English (en): The developers of Voyant Tools gather data from the site about what tools are invoked and with what parameters (IP addresses are also logged in order to be able to identify multiple requests during a same session). In addition, Voyant Tools uses Google Analytics (see Google's Privacy Policy and the Log Information section in particular). Locally logged data and Google Analytics data will be used by the development team in order to debug and improve the tools, as well as to understand how researchers are using them. This data may also be used for research purposes in anonymous and aggregate forms. Please note that texts submitted to Voyant Tools are stored in order to allow persistent access during a work session and between work sessions. If you have questions about the data being collected and how it is being used, or to request that a corpus be removed, please contact Stéfan Sinclair. Click on this link for more information.

I dati tracciati localmente e Google Analytics saranno utilizzati dal gruppo di sviluppatori per il debug e il miglioramento degli strumenti,  e anche per capire come i ricercatori li utilizzano. English (en): The minimum number of occurrences for terms. By default this is set to 2 (repeating words) to improve performance, setting it to 1 may slow things down considerably.
Italian (it): Il minimo numero di occorrenze per i termini. Per default è posto a 2 (parole ripetute) per aumentare l'efficienza, porlo a 1 potrebbe rallentare considerevolmente lo strumento
Czech (cz): Minimální hodnota jevů pro každý termín. V základním nastavení je tato hodnota 2 (opakující se slova), aby byla zajištěna lepší výkonnost. Nastavení hodnoty na 1 může mít za následek značné zpomalení.

English (en): Mandala is a conceptual visualization that shows the relationships between terms and documents. Each search term (or magnet) pulls documents toward it based on the term's relative frequency in the corpus.
Italian (it): Mandala è una visualizzazione concettuale che mostra le relazioni tra parole e documenti. Ogni termine riceratgo (o magnete) attire verso di se i documenti sulla base della sua frequenza relativa nel corpus.
Czech (cz): Mandala je konceptuální vizualizací, která ukazuje vztahy mezi termíny a dokumenty. Každý vyhledávací termín (neboli magnet) k sobě přitahuje dokumenty v závislosti na relativní frekvenci termínu v korpusu.
